node.text: Today on our story, Gabriella Karefa-Johnson (@gabriellak_j), the fashion director of @garage_magazine, shares a Fashion Month Trend Report ✅ of her six favorite trends from the runways of NYC, London, Milan and Paris. 💗👗👢 Check out our story, then see more on @garage_magazine.

Though injuries are what brought them together, this sisterhood of women proves that sometimes life’s accidents yield the most beautiful rewards.⁣
⁣
“The Rollettes empower each other so much because one girl will have something super exciting going on, and we all support her,” says founder Chelsie Hill (@chelsiehill). “Another girl will be going through a really tough time and then we all support her. And it truly is and has become a sisterhood that we’ve built with this team.”⁣
⁣
This #InternationalWomensDay we’ve partnered with @brutamerica to highlight amazing women around the world, starting with the Rollettes. See them dance on our IGTV now!

We’re celebrating #InternationalWomensDay with the Rollettes (@rollettes_la), a wheelchair dance group based in Los Angeles whose mission is to show women all around the world how to live freely and fully no matter the circumstances life throws at you.⁣
💛🧡⁣
“I can finally say that I’m thankful for my injury because I have created a group of women that I never would have met,” says founder Chelsie Hill (@chelsiehill), who lost the use of her legs after a spinal cord injury.⁣
⁣
Every year, the Rollettes host “The Rollettes Experience” in LA, bringing together hundreds of women and girls from around the world for a weekend of empowerment. “I never thought about the joy and the happiness that it would bring me just to be able to sit back and watch girls connect with each other,” says Chelsie, “to have a space for people who are newly injured to feel like they belong somewhere.”⁣
💛🧡⁣
This week with @brutamerica, we’re highlighting women around the world who are using their lives to encourage and empower others. To see more of the Rollettes, check out our IGTV video now. ✨

#HelloFrom Nuorgam, Finland, during Polar Night, a 52-day period when the sun doesn’t rise above the horizon but there’s just enough sunlight to make this beautiful blue hue. “The colors of the blue hour are one of a kind, making everything look like a winter wonderland,” says photographer Konsta Punkka (@kpunkka).⁣
⁣
Photo by @kpunkka

You would never know it based on her work fighting and educating people around the world about climate change, but Vanessa Nakate (@vanessanakate1) is naturally shy. ⁣
🌍💚 ⁣
“When I speak and I sound confident, it is because I’m speaking from my heart,” says the activist from Uganda. “In this fight, weaknesses don’t count. We need to put all that aside and focus on one goal, and that is getting the action that we need. There is beauty in raising your voice.⁣
⁣
So personally, my favorite part of being a woman, is my mouth. I just love what comes out each time I speak. That is how we lead, through speaking up.” ⁣
🗣💙 ⁣
This week, we’re celebrating #InternationalWomensDay with @brutamerica and highlighting women, like Vanessa, from around the world who are using their lives to encourage and empower others.

All this color can only mean one thing: Holi is here. 🌹🌼🦋🌿✨⁣⁣⁣
⁣
New Delhi-based photojournalist Ashish Sharma (@ashishsharmaphotos) describes Holi as joyous and cheerful, “where people are united to celebrate the colors of life.”⁣⁣⁣
⁣
The centuries-old festival celebrated in India and in other Hindu communities around the world brings people together to welcome springtime with music, laughter, dancing and colored powder — lots and lots of colored powder.⁣⁣
⁣
The green represents new beginnings, yellow signifies turmeric, blue is for Krishna and red is for love.⁣⁣⁣
⁣
Today we’re sharing some vibrant moments from the festival and the weeklong celebrations leading up to it, viewed through Ashish’s lens.⁣⁣⁣
⁣
Photos by @ashishsharmaphotos

For Rupi Kaur (@rupikaur_), poetry has always been her avenue for self-expression. 📝✨“I can’t believe that I get to wake up and do something that allows me to connect with people every day,” says Rupi.⁣
⁣
“Women are so powerful, and what’s so wonderful is that we’re discovering how much power there is more and more every single day. How it’s been locked away by misogyny and patriarchy and as generations move on, we’re totally coming together to unlock that one by one. It’s so, so, so neat. I love being a woman.” 💛⁣
⁣
This week, we’re celebrating #InternationalWomensDay with @brutamerica and highlighting women from around the world who are using their lives to encourage and empower others. Check out today’s story to see more from Rupi, and swipe through to read “Timeless,” Rupi’s favorite poem she’s written about feminism.

Liv Little (@livslittle) started gal-dem (@galdemzine), a publication that shares the perspectives of women and nonbinary people of color, as a response to the lack of diversity she was experiencing in her own life. ✊💙🌈⁣
⁣
“I’m quite literally obsessed with telling people’s stories,” says the writer from London. “It's my mission to stay curious.”⁣
⁣
“I have the best friends and peers who offer the best advice. And my mum — she’s my rock. She’s fierce in her ability to tell it like it is and simultaneously is one of the kindest and most resilient people I know.”⁣
⁣
This week, we’re celebrating #InternationalWomensDay with @brutamerica and highlighting women, like Liv, from around the world who are using their lives to encourage and empower others.✨💜

For Enam Asiama (@enamasiama), a model and advocate based in London, her “goddess energy” = the foundation of who she is and how she moves through the world. 🌹💫⁣
⁣
“You’re grounded, but at the same time quite powerful,” she says. “Because I’m told that I’m not good enough in so many ways, the power that I feel is even stronger, because I’m trying to let that light shine even brighter.” ✨⁣
⁣
A few years ago, Enam decided to get rid of the mirrors in her home to redefine where her self-confidence comes from. “I don’t have to necessarily look in a mirror to gain confidence. I just trust that what I’m wearing and what I look like is good enough. So when I step outside, my main focus is that I’ve already come to an understanding of who I am and what I want for myself.” 💛⁣
⁣
This week, we’re celebrating #InternationalWomensDay with @brutamerica and highlighting women, like Enam, from around the world who are using their lives to encourage and empower others. Learn more about Enam on today’s story.

At the age of 16, Julie Bourges (@douzefevrier) was involved in an accident that left her body covered in burns. Today, she is a role model for self-acceptance.⁣
⁣
“I love not being afraid to show what I am and to show my scars,” says Julie. "I have a bit of a warrior mentality. To be able to fall, get back up and overcome it. To be able to start over. My favorite thing about being a woman is being able to throw myself into challenges and overcome them daily.” 💪⁣
⁣
This week, we celebrated #InternationalWomensDay with @brutamerica by highlighting women from around the world who are using their lives to encourage and empower others. Julie is seaside with us on today’s story. 🌊💙 ⁣
⁣
Photo by @douzefevrier

One of these fluffs is not like the others. On today’s #WeeklyFluff, meet Nugget (@nugget_thecockapoo) who enjoys hanging out with the herd on her family’s alpaca farm.⁣
⁣
Video by @nugget_thecockapoo

#HelloFrom the “Face House” (Kao no ie) in Kyoto, Japan. Designed by architect Kazumasa Yamashita, this 🤖 brings a pop of color and joy to the otherwise monochromatic neighborhood.⁣
⁣
Photo by @sebastien.nagy
